channel.title: Declaring Events :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Up to this point, you’ve probably only used events that were defined on library objects, like the Button’s Click event. However, you can also declare events in your own classes, and even create new event types. In order to attach an event handler to an object in C#, we must first declare that that object has the corresponding event. To do so, we need both a name for the event, and a delegate.
